atoms.description: The current After Effects project. Read-only.
atoms.notes: Returns the currently open Project object.

atoms.description: Version string of the running After Effects application.
The name of the build of After Effects.
Build number of the running After Effects application.
True if running in render engine mode (aerender).
True if running a beta version of After Effects.
Language After Effects is running in.
atoms.notes: Read-only. ENGLISH, JAPANESE, FRENCH, GERMAN, etc.

atoms.description: The application settings.
The application preferences.
The currently focused viewer panel.
atoms.notes: Read-only. May be null if no viewer is active.

atoms.description: Array of all installed effects, each with name, matchName, and category.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Useful for finding effect matchNames.

atoms.description: Available GPU acceleration types on this machine.
Creates a new project, closing existing one after save dialog.
Opens a project file.
atoms.notes: file: File object. Returns the opened Project.

atoms.description: Quits After Effects.
atoms.notes: Will prompt to save if there are unsaved changes.

atoms.description: Opens a new undo group with the given label.
atoms.notes: CRITICAL: Always pair with endUndoGroup(). undoString appears in Edit > Undo menu. All operations between begin and end are treated as a single undoable action.

atoms.description: Closes the current undo group.
atoms.notes: CRITICAL: Must be called to close a group opened by beginUndoGroup(). Use try/finally to ensure it always runs.

atoms.description: Suppresses all dialog boxes that might appear during script execution.
atoms.notes: Pair with endSuppressDialogs(). Use when running unattended scripts.

atoms.description: Ends dialog suppression. If alert is true, shows any collected warnings.
atoms.notes: alert: Boolean. Set to false to discard suppressed dialogs.

atoms.description: Purges memory and disk cache.
atoms.notes: target: PurgeTarget enum (ALL_CACHES, UNDO_CACHES, SNAPSHOT_CACHES, IMAGE_CACHES).

atoms.description: Sets the memory usage limits.
Controls whether preferences are saved when quitting.
Executes a menu command by ID.
atoms.notes: commandId: Integer. Use app.findMenuCommandId() to get IDs.

atoms.description: Returns the numeric command ID for a menu command name.
Schedules script to execute after a delay.
atoms.notes: stringToExecute: String of code. delay: milliseconds. repeat: Boolean. Returns task ID.

atoms.description: Cancels a previously scheduled task.
Loads color data from an Adobe Swatch Exchange (.ase) file.
The file for the currently open project.
The root folder of the project.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Contains all items in the project panel.

atoms.description: All items in the project (comps, footage, folders).
The currently active item in the Project panel.
atoms.notes: Read-only. May be null. Check with instanceof CompItem before using as a comp.

atoms.description: Array of all selected items in the project panel.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Empty array if nothing is selected.

atoms.description: Total number of items in the project.
The render queue for the project.
Project color depth: 8, 16, or 32 bits per channel.
True if project uses linear blending (Blend Colors Using 1.0 Gamma).
True if thumbnails show transparency grid.
Current expression engine: 'extendscript' or 'javascript-1.0'.
How time is displayed in the project.
True if using Feet+Frames timecode display.
Film type when using feet+frames.
How frames are counted (start from 0 or 1).
Controls start-time display for footage items.
Current GPU acceleration type.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Check app.availableGPUAccelTypes for valid values.

atoms.description: Saves the project. If file is provided, saves to that location.
atoms.notes: file: File object (optional). If omitted, saves to current location.

atoms.description: Closes the project.
Imports a file into the project.
atoms.notes: importOptions: ImportOptions object. Returns the new FootageItem.

atoms.description: Opens the Import File dialog.
atoms.notes: Returns array of imported items, or null if user cancels.

atoms.description: Creates a placeholder in the project.
Gets the item at the specified index.
Consolidates duplicate footage sources.
Removes footage items not used in any composition.
Reduces the project to only the specified items and their dependencies.
atoms.notes: array_of_items: Array of Item objects to keep. Returns number of items removed.

atoms.description: Shows or hides the Project panel.
Automatically replaces text in all expressions in the project.
atoms.notes: Useful after renaming layers or compositions that are referenced in expressions.

atoms.description: Number of layers in the composition.
The layers in this composition.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Access layers by index (1-based) or name.

atoms.description: The active camera layer at the current time.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Null if no camera or if 2D comp.

atoms.description: Width of the composition in pixels.
Height of the composition in pixels.
Pixel aspect ratio of the composition.
Frame rate of the composition in frames per second.
Duration of the composition in seconds.
Start time of the work area in seconds.
Duration of the work area in seconds.
Start time displayed in the comp panel in seconds.
Start frame number for display purposes.
Shutter angle for motion blur in degrees (0-720).
Shutter phase for motion blur in degrees (-360 to 360).
True if motion blur is enabled for the composition.
Number of motion blur samples per frame.
Adaptive sample limit for motion blur.
True if nested composition frame rates are preserved.
True if nested composition resolution is preserved.
Background color of the composition as [R,G,B] array (0-1).
atoms.notes: Read/write. Values are floats from 0.0 to 1.0.

atoms.description: Render resolution factor [x,y].
Current renderer used for the composition.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Check renderers property for valid values.

atoms.description: List of available renderers for this composition.
Array of currently selected layers in the composition.
Array of selected properties across all layers.
Gets a layer by 1-based index or by name string.
atoms.notes: Returns the Layer object. Throws error if not found.

atoms.description: Opens the composition in a Viewer panel.
atoms.notes: Returns the Viewer object, or null if it cannot be opened.

atoms.description: Duplicates the composition.
Current time of the comp's time indicator in seconds.
Adds a null object layer to the composition.
atoms.notes: duration: Float (optional, defaults to comp duration). Creates a 100x100 pixel null layer.

atoms.description: Adds a solid color layer.
atoms.notes: color: [R,G,B] (0-1). name: String. width/height: Integer. pixelAspect: Float. duration: Float (optional).

atoms.description: Adds a text layer.
atoms.notes: sourceText: String or TextDocument (optional). Empty string if omitted.

atoms.description: Adds a new empty shape layer.
Adds a camera layer.
Adds a light layer.
Adds a box (paragraph) text layer.
atoms.notes: sourceText: String or TextDocument. boxSize: [width, height] in pixels.

atoms.description: Returns the first layer with the given name.
atoms.notes: name: String. Returns null if not found.

atoms.description: Pre-composes the specified layers into a new composition.
atoms.notes: layerIndices: Array of 1-based indices. name: String for new comp. moveAllAttributes: Boolean (true moves all attributes to new comp).

atoms.description: The source item for this layer.
True if the layer name comes from its source item.
Height of the source in pixels.
Width of the source in pixels.
True if audio is enabled for this layer.
True if audio is active at the current time.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Depends on audioEnabled, solo, mute states.

atoms.description: The blending mode for this layer.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Values: BlendingMode.ADD, MULTIPLY, SCREEN, NORMAL, etc.

atoms.description: True if collapse transformation can be enabled.
True if collapse transformation / continuously rasterize is on.
True if effects are active on this layer.
True if this is an environment layer.
True if frame blending is enabled.
Frame blending type (NO_FRAME_BLEND, FRAME_MIX, PIXEL_MOTION).
True if this is a guide layer (visible only in this comp).
True if this layer has a track matte.
True if this layer is being used as a track matte.
The track matte type applied to this layer.
atoms.notes: Read/write. ALPHA, ALPHA_INVERTED, LUMA, LUMA_INVERTED, NO_TRACK_MATTE.

atoms.description: True if motion blur is enabled for this layer.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Comp-level motionBlur must also be enabled.

atoms.description: True if preserve transparency is enabled.
Rendering quality of the layer.
Sampling quality (bicubic or bilinear).
True if this is a 3D layer.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Enabling 3D adds Z-axis transform properties.

atoms.description: True if per-character 3D is enabled (text layers).
True if time remapping is enabled.
True if time remapping can be enabled.
True if this is an adjustment layer.
Auto-orientation mode.
Replaces the source item for this layer.
atoms.notes: newSource: AVItem. fixExpressions: Boolean. Set fixExpressions to true to update expression references.

atoms.description: Gets the bounding rectangle of the layer content at a specific time.
atoms.notes: timeT: Float (seconds). extents: Boolean. Essential for text/shape layers to get actual content bounds.

atoms.description: Converts layer coordinates to composition coordinates.
Converts composition coordinates to layer coordinates.
Opens the layer in a Layer panel.
The 1-based index of this layer in the composition.
The name of this layer.
True if the layer is enabled (eye icon on).
atoms.notes: Read/write. Corresponds to the visibility toggle.

atoms.description: True if the layer is soloed.
True if the layer is shy (hidden when shy mode is on).
True if the layer is locked.
Comment text for the layer.
Label color index (0-16).
The composition that contains this layer.
The parent layer (for parenting/hierarchy).
atoms.notes: Read/write. Null if no parent. Set to null to unparent.

atoms.description: In-point of the layer in composition time (seconds).
Out-point of the layer in composition time (seconds).
Start time of the layer in composition time (seconds).
atoms.notes: Read/write. Changing this shifts the layer in time.

atoms.description: Time stretch percentage (100 = normal, 200 = half speed, 50 = double speed).
Array of currently selected properties on this layer.
Removes the layer from the composition.
Duplicates this layer.
Copies this layer into another composition.
Moves the layer to the top of the layer stack (index 1).
Moves the layer to the bottom of the layer stack.
Moves this layer to be after (below) the specified layer.
Moves this layer to be before (above) the specified layer.
Sets parent layer while preserving the layer's visual position.
atoms.notes: newParent: Layer or null. Adjusts transform to compensate for new parent.

atoms.description: Gets a property by name or match name.
atoms.notes: propertyName: String. Use matchNames for reliable access (e.g., 'ADBE Transform Group').

atoms.description: True if the layer is active at the specified time.
atoms.notes: time: Float (seconds). Considers inPoint, outPoint, and enabled state.

atoms.description: The current value of the property (post-expression).
atoms.notes: Read-only. Type depends on propertyValueType. Use setValue() to change.

atoms.description: Number of keyframes on this property.
The expression string for this property.
True if the expression is enabled.
Error message from expression evaluation. Empty if no error.
True if an expression can be set on this property.
True if this property can be keyframed.
True if property defines a spatial value (has motion path).
True if the property varies over time (keyframes or expression).
The type of value stored in this property.
atoms.notes: Read-only. NO_VALUE, OneD, TwoD, TwoD_SPATIAL, ThreeD, ThreeD_SPATIAL, COLOR, TEXT_DOCUMENT, MARKER, SHAPE, etc.

atoms.description: True if multidimensional property is separated into individual dimensions.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Only for properties that support separation (like Position).

atoms.description: True if this property has a minimum value.
True if this property has a maximum value.
Minimum permitted value.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Only valid if hasMin is true.

atoms.description: Maximum permitted value.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Only valid if hasMax is true.

atoms.description: Indices of currently selected keyframes.
Text description of the property's units (e.g., 'Pixels', 'Percent').
Sets the static value of the property (removes all keyframes).
atoms.notes: newValue type depends on propertyValueType. For position: [x,y] or [x,y,z].

atoms.description: Sets value at a specific time, creating a keyframe if needed.
atoms.notes: time: Float (seconds). newValue: type depends on property.

atoms.description: Sets multiple keyframe values at once.
atoms.notes: times: Array of Float. values: Array of values. Must have same length.

atoms.description: Gets the value at a specific time.
atoms.notes: time: Float. preExpression: Boolean (true = pre-expression value). Returns type based on propertyValueType.

atoms.description: Adds a keyframe at the specified time.
atoms.notes: time: Float (seconds). Returns the 1-based keyframe index.

atoms.description: Removes the keyframe at the given index.
Returns the time of the keyframe at the given index.
atoms.notes: keyIndex: Integer (1-based). Returns time in seconds.

atoms.description: Returns the value of the keyframe at the given index.
Returns the index of the keyframe nearest to the given time.
Sets interpolation type at a keyframe.
atoms.notes: keyIndex: Integer. inType/outType: KeyframeInterpolationType (LINEAR, BEZIER, HOLD).

atoms.description: Sets temporal ease at a keyframe for smooth animation.
atoms.notes: keyIndex: Integer. inEase/outEase: Array of KeyframeEase objects. One per dimension.

atoms.description: Sets spatial tangent vectors for motion path at a keyframe.
atoms.notes: For spatial properties only. inTangent/outTangent: [x,y] or [x,y,z].

atoms.description: Turns roving on or off at a keyframe.
atoms.notes: keyIndex: Integer. newVal: Boolean. Roving keys adjust timing for smooth motion.

atoms.description: Display name of the property.
atoms.notes: Read/write for some (like effects and masks).

atoms.description: Internal match name used by scripts to reliably reference properties.
atoms.notes: Read-only. More reliable than display names which may be localized.

atoms.description: Whether this is a PROPERTY or INDEXED_GROUP or NAMED_GROUP.
atoms.notes: Read-only. PROPERTY for leaf values, INDEXED_GROUP/NAMED_GROUP for groups.

atoms.description: The parent property group.
True if the property has been modified from its default.
True if the enabled state can be set.
True if this property is active (enabled and not hidden).
True if this property is an effect.
True if this property is a mask.
True if this property is selected in the timeline.
Removes this property from its parent group.
atoms.notes: Only works for user-added properties (effects, masks).

atoms.description: Moves this property to a new index within its parent group.
Duplicates this property.
atoms.notes: Only for user-added properties. Returns the new PropertyBase.

atoms.description: Number of child properties in this group.
Gets a child property by 1-based index or name/matchName.
atoms.notes: Returns PropertyBase. Null if not found by name.

atoms.description: Adds a property to this group (e.g., adding an effect or mask).
atoms.notes: name: display name or matchName. Use canAddProperty() to check first.

atoms.description: Returns true if a property with the given name can be added.
Speed component of the keyframe ease.
Influence (strength) of the keyframe ease as a percentage (0-100).
atoms.notes: Read/write. Higher values mean more gradual acceleration/deceleration.

atoms.description: The text content of the text layer.
Font size in pixels.
The PostScript name of the font.
Fill color as [R,G,B] array (0-1).
Stroke color as [R,G,B] array (0-1).
Stroke width in pixels.
True if fill is applied to text.
True if stroke is applied to text.
True if stroke renders over fill.
Text justification/alignment.
atoms.notes: Read/write. LEFT_JUSTIFY, CENTER_JUSTIFY, RIGHT_JUSTIFY, FULL_JUSTIFY_LASTLINE_LEFT, etc.

atoms.description: Tracking (letter spacing) value.
Line spacing (leading) in pixels.
Array of baseline position data for each line of text.
atoms.notes: Read-only. Groups of 4 values per line: [lineStart, lineAscent, lineEnd, lineDescent].

atoms.description: Size of the box text bounding box in pixels.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Only valid for box (paragraph) text.

atoms.description: True if this is box (paragraph) text, false if point text.
True if all caps is enabled.
True if small caps is enabled.
Baseline shift in pixels.
True if the shape path is closed.
Array of vertex points for the shape.
Array of incoming tangent vectors for each vertex.
Array of outgoing tangent vectors for each vertex.
The file to import.
atoms.notes: Read/write. Must be set before calling importFile().

atoms.description: How to import: COMP, FOOTAGE, COMP_CROPPED_LAYERS, PROJECT.
True if importing as an image sequence.
Returns true if the file can be imported as the given type.
The comment text of the marker.
Chapter name for the marker.
Web cue point name.
Duration of the marker in seconds.
True if this is an event cue point, false if navigation.
URL associated with the marker.
Frame target for the URL.
Color label index for the marker (0-16).
True if the marker defines a protected region.

gotchas.title: Use var, not let or const
gotchas.description: ExtendScript is ES3-based. let, const, arrow functions, template literals, destructuring, for...of, Promises, and async/await are NOT supported. Always use var and traditional function expressions.

gotchas.title: Layer indices are 1-based
gotchas.description: All collection indices in ExtendScript start at 1, not 0. comp.layer(1) is the first layer, comp.numLayers is the last. Same for properties: property(1) is the first child.

gotchas.title: Always check activeItem is a CompItem
gotchas.description: app.project.activeItem can be null, a FolderItem, or a FootageItem. Always verify with: if (!(comp instanceof CompItem)) return; before accessing .layers or .numLayers.

gotchas.title: Always use undo groups
gotchas.description: Wrap all operations in app.beginUndoGroup() / app.endUndoGroup(). Without this, each individual property change creates a separate undo step, and the user cannot undo your script as a single action.

gotchas.title: endUndoGroup must always run
gotchas.description: If an error occurs between beginUndoGroup and endUndoGroup, the undo state can become corrupted. Always use try/catch/finally with endUndoGroup() in the finally block.

gotchas.title: setValue removes all keyframes
gotchas.description: Calling property.setValue() on a keyframed property removes ALL keyframes and sets a static value. To set a value at a specific time without removing keyframes, use setValueAtTime() instead.

gotchas.title: Color values are 0-1, not 0-255
gotchas.description: All color values in ExtendScript use 0.0 to 1.0 range, not 0-255. Red is [1,0,0], white is [1,1,1]. To convert: divide each channel by 255.

gotchas.title: Use matchNames for reliable property access
gotchas.description: Display names can change between AE versions and localizations. Use matchNames (e.g., 'ADBE Transform Group', 'ADBE Position', 'ADBE Opacity') for reliable cross-version scripts.

gotchas.title: No alert() in CEP scripts
gotchas.description: Do NOT use alert() or confirm() in scripts run via CEP evalScript. They can freeze the panel. Return results as strings instead.

gotchas.title: Time values are in seconds, not frames
gotchas.description: All time values in ExtendScript are in seconds as floats, not frame numbers. To convert frames to seconds: frameNumber / comp.frameRate. To convert seconds to frames: seconds * comp.frameRate.

gotchas.title: KeyframeEase needs one object per dimension
gotchas.description: When calling setTemporalEaseAtKey(), provide an array of KeyframeEase objects matching the property's dimensions. Position (2D) needs [ease, ease], 3D Position needs [ease, ease, ease], single-value properties need [ease].

gotchas.title: TextDocument: set then setValue
gotchas.description: To modify text properties, get the TextDocument from the text property's value, modify it, then call setValue() with the modified document. You cannot directly set sub-properties like fontSize on the property.

gotchas.title: Shape layers: use matchNames for content
gotchas.description: Shape layer contents use matchNames like 'ADBE Vector Group', 'ADBE Vector Shape - Rect', 'ADBE Vector Graphic - Fill'. The display names ('Rectangle 1', 'Fill 1') vary by language.

gotchas.title: Property value types differ
gotchas.description: Property values vary by type: Position is [x,y] or [x,y,z], Opacity is a single number (0-100), Color is [r,g,b] or [r,g,b,a] (0-1), Rotation is degrees. Always check propertyValueType.

gotchas.title: Avoid modifying layers while iterating
gotchas.description: Adding or removing layers during a loop over comp.numLayers will cause index shifts and missed/doubled layers. Collect references first, then modify, or iterate in reverse.

gotchas.title: Effects matchNames require the full ADBE prefix
gotchas.description: Effect matchNames start with 'ADBE' (e.g., 'ADBE Gaussian Blur 2', 'ADBE Drop Shadow'). Effect property matchNames append a counter suffix (e.g., 'ADBE Gaussian Blur 2-0001' for Blurriness).

gotchas.title: sourceRectAtTime is essential for text/shape positioning
gotchas.description: Text and shape layers have dynamic bounds. Use layer.sourceRectAtTime(time, false) to get actual {top, left, width, height} for accurate positioning and anchor point calculation.

gotchas.title: Expressions use different syntax than scripts
gotchas.description: Expressions run inside After Effects and use JavaScript/ExtendScript expression syntax. They reference properties via thisComp, thisLayer, etc. Scripts run externally and use the scripting API. Don't confuse the two.

gotchas.title: String concatenation only, no template literals
gotchas.description: ExtendScript does not support backtick template literals (`). Always use string concatenation with + operator: 'Value: ' + myVar + ' units'.

gotchas.title: No for...of or for...in for arrays
gotchas.description: ExtendScript does not support for...of loops. Use traditional for loops: for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++). for...in on arrays can include prototype properties.

gotchas.title: File paths use forward slashes or File object
gotchas.description: Use forward slashes in file paths or the File/Folder constructors: new File('/Users/name/file.mov') or File.openDialog() for user selection.

gotchas.title: Precompose layerIndices are 1-based integers
gotchas.description: The precompose() method expects an array of 1-based integer indices, not layer objects. Collect indices: var indices = []; for (var i = 0; i < sel.length; i++) indices.push(sel[i].index);

gotchas.title: 3D layers need threeDLayer = true
gotchas.description: To access Z position, Z rotation, or material options, the layer must have threeDLayer set to true. Otherwise, Position is [x,y] only.

gotchas.title: Motion blur requires both comp and layer settings
gotchas.description: For motion blur to render, BOTH comp.motionBlur must be true AND the individual layer.motionBlur must be true. Enabling only one is not sufficient.

gotchas.title: Track mattes use the layer above
gotchas.description: A track matte uses the layer directly above it in the stack. When setting trackMatteType, ensure the matte layer is at index (targetLayer.index - 1).
